weather_report:
The afternoon in Downtown San Francisco unfolds beneath a crisp blue sky, elements of warmth and gentle breezes embracing the city. With temperatures hovering in the upper 50s, the day feels to carry a distinctive clarity, particularly for this time of year. While indications suggest a gradual descent in warmth, the radiant sun holds its ground, coaxing life from the streets and encouraging an air of vibrant possibility. However, signs of the elusive marine layer whisper along the horizon toward the Golden Gate, hinting at the restorative embrace of fog later in the evening. As twilight approaches, skies shift toward a more muted palette, inviting the kind of languid calm that often accompanies the night.

Dressing for this transition calls for layers—a light sweater or jacket combined with a simple long-sleeve shirt, prepared for the coolness that will accompany falling temperatures and increasing cloud cover. With the weather inviting, one might wander to a local café, savoring a warm beverage while observing the city exhale its retrofitted charm. Alternatively, a stroll along the Embarcadero, allowing the waterfront breeze to refresh your spirit, can be an intimate engagement with the lingering daylight. Today's weather seems to gently remind all who venture out to embrace both the chill and the serenity of a typical San Francisco evening.
